Is there any way to create a `{{ hubdb.variable }}` that can be used throughout the CMS in rich text editors or module input fields? Think of it like a `[ shortcode ]`.

I know this can be done by creating custom modules but I'm hoping there is a work around so this variable can be sprinkled through content across the site.

<https://www.loom.com/share/7098b345f531491f9b74ae0673a32851?sid=fca13987-91d6-4cd4-b34c-f9e5cf8c1fde>
So you are looking for a short code (that can be accessed everywhere) to access a specific cell in a specific row of a specific table?

We need a way to specify which table and which row to access the cells of a particular row.. Thats why custom module is a good way where we can select a table row using HubDBTableRow field... So you are trying to achieve the same without using a custom module?
Will it help if you are able to access using some hubl like `{{hubdb.table_name.row_id.column_name}}` ?

<@UG52C29EE> Thanks for jumping in.  Yes, ideally I'd like to have a shortcode that can be accessed on any page and can be managed somewhere. That would be in a perfect world.

It would help if I could simply reference `{{hubdb.table_name.row_id.column_name}}`  in any module via the rich text editor or any text input filed a module includes.

I do realize the normal way to do this is with a single custom module that references the HubDB table.
